FuncDef:
The import-route command enables IS-IS to import routes from other protocols.
The undo import-route command disables IS-IS from importing routes from other protocols. The import-route command enables IS-IS to import routes from other protocols. The undo import-route command disables IS-IS from importing routes from other protocols. By default, IS-IS does not import routes from any other protocol.
CLIs: import-route { direct | static | { ospf | rip | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp } [ cost-type { external | internal } | cost <cost> | tag <tag> | { route-policy <route-policy-name> } | [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ] ]
import-route { { ospf | rip | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp | direct } inherit-cost [ { level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 } | tag <tag> | route-policy <route-policy-name> ]
undo import-route { direct | static | { ospf | rip | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp }

ParaDef.Info:
Imports IS-IS routes.Before you specify this parameter, enable an IS-IS process with a.
process-id different from the local one.
-

Specifies the process ID of the imported protocol.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 1.

The cost type of a route.
-

Sets the cost type to IS-IS external.
-

Sets the cost type to IS-IS internal or sets the MED of a BGP route to the cost of the IGP route to which the BGP route recurses. This parameter takes effect only on EBGP peers.
-

Specifies a cost for the imported route.
The value is an integer. The value range varies with the cost type.
If the cost type of the device is wide or wide-compatible, the value ranges from 0 to 4261412864.For other cost types, the value ranges from 0 to 63.
The default value is 0.
The cost type can be configured using the cost-style command.

Specifies the administrative tag assigned to the imported routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of a route-policy. The routing policy is used to filter the imported routes so that only some of the routes of other routing domains can be imported.
The name is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Imports routes to the Level-1 routing table.
-

Imports routes to the Level-2 routing table.
If the level of the routing table to which routes are imported is not specified in the command, the routes are imported to the Level-2 routing table by default.
-

Imports routes to Level-1 and Level-2 routing tables.
-

Retains the original cost of the imported route.
If this parameter is specified, no other cost type or cost value can be configured for the imported route, and the imported route cannot be a static route.
-

ExtraInfo: When IS-IS and other routing protocols are deployed on a network, you can use either of the following methods to allow traffic within an IS-IS domain to reach a destination outside the IS-IS domain:
